\", \"image\": null, \"author\": \"DANIEL REICHERT, FOUNDER\"}}, {\"type\": \"standard_paragraph\", \"value\": {\"headline\": \"About us\", \"text\": \"

We are a non-party, non-profit association based in Berlin. We like to describe ourselves as a think & do tank. Since 2009, we have been working on innovative concepts and methods for citizen participation. The key element of our work is the development of Adhocracy, a free software which serves as a digital participation tool. It offers various functions for the different needs of our users. In addition, we are developing Thentos, an identity management system which ensures privacy during complex participation processes.

We cooperate with a wide range of institutions: from political parties to small initiatives, municipalities and federal institutions, international organisations and local initiatives.

Liquid Democracy is also an innovative concept of participatory democracy. Participation is a key to individual empowerment and active citizenship. Our work is based on the belief that democracy in its current state should be more dynamic and allow for more participation. The fix elements and structures of representative democracy should thus be \\u00bbliquefied\\u00ab.

As a method, Liquid Democracy uses digital technology to integrate individuals in decision-making. The design of our technology ensures a low-threshold and efficient participation that is time and place independent.

\"}}]", "numchild": 0, "title_en": "We innovate democracy by developing digital tools for citizen participation.", "content_type": 26, "show_in_menus": false, "path": "000100010002", "url_path": "/home/about/", "expired": false, "pk": 11, "locked": false, "depth": 3, "intro_de": "", "body_de": "[]", "first_published_at": "2016-04-01T17:07:09.840Z", "expire_at": null}

{"title_de": "", "search_description": "", "owner": 1, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "go_live_at": null, "title": "Student Job", "seo_title": "", "slug": "student-job", "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "body_en": "

Werde Teil unseres Projektmanagement-Teams und arbeite mit uns an innovativen Projekten f\u00fcr eine Demokratie des 21. Jahrhunderts!

Wir \u00fcber uns

Der Liquid Democracy e.V. ist ein gemeinn\u00fctziger Verein mit Sitz in Berlin. Unsere Leitidee besteht darin, die M\u00f6glichkeiten digitaler Technologien zu nutzen, um Entscheidungsprozesse partizipativer, demokratischer und transparenter zu gestalten. Seit 2009 entwickeln wir daher die freie Software Adhocracy, mittels derer wir digitale B\u00fcrgerbeteiligung in den verschiedensten gesellschaftlichen und organisatorischen Kontexten erm\u00f6glichen. Wir arbeiten gemeinsam mit Kunden und Partnern aus Politik, \u00f6ffentlicher Verwaltung und zivilgesellschaftlichen Organisationen. Zudem betreiben und f\u00f6rdern wir Forschung im Bereich der E-Partizipation

Du bist

  • im fortgeschrittenen Bachelor- oder Masterstudium eines sozial-, geisteswissenschaftlichen oder \u00e4hnlichen Fachs
  • interessiert an gemeinn\u00fctzigen Projekten, Freier Software und partizipativer Demokratie
  • sicher im Umgang mit g\u00e4ngigen Office-Programmen
  • ein Organisationstalent
  • in der Lage, sicher auf deutsch und englisch zu kommunizieren, sowohl in Sprache als auch in Schrift
  • motiviert, lernf\u00e4hig und in hohem Ma\u00dfe selbst\u00e4ndig in Deiner Arbeit
  • erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement und/oder mit SCRUM sind von Vorteil.

Deine Aufgaben

  • Unterst\u00fctzung der Projektleitung, unter anderem bei:
    • Planung, Koordination und Organisation von mittleren und gro\u00dfen Projekten
    • Konzeption von Anforderungsworkshops und Kundenpr\u00e4sentationen
  • administrative und konzeptionelle Unterst\u00fctzung des Projektteams
  • eigenst\u00e4ndiges und verantwortliches Arbeiten im Team

\", \"col2_text\": \"

fields.title_en: We innovate democracy by developing digital tools for citizen participation.
fields.intro_en: Democratic decision-making can be improved in many different fields of society. Our mission is to promote the advantages of online participation in all kinds of contexts, from international organisations to small local initiatives.
fields.body_en:
[{"type": "ThreeImageLinks", "value": {"image_left": {"image": 7, "internal_link": null, "link_text": "We do research within a network of academics and practitioners", "external_url": "https://fold.liqd.net/"}, "image_middle": {"image": 8, "internal_link": 3, "link_text": "We develop free software", "external_url": ""}, "image_right": {"image": 9, "internal_link": 3, "link_text": "We turn our theory into practice", "external_url": ""}}}, {"type": "quote_paragraph", "value": {"color": "green", "text": "

\u00bbLiquid Democracy is not dogmatic. Our iterative approach to developing methods and tools allows for innovation and is open and applicable to existing structures.\u00ab\u2028

", "image": null, "author": "DANIEL REICHERT, FOUNDER"}}, {"type": "standard_paragraph", "value": {"headline": "About us", "text": "

We are a non-party, non-profit association based in Berlin. We like to describe ourselves as a think & do tank. Since 2009, we have been working on innovative concepts and methods for citizen participation. The key element of our work is the development of Adhocracy, a free software which serves as a digital participation tool. It offers various functions for the different needs of our users. In addition, we are developing Thentos, an identity management system which ensures privacy during complex participation processes.

We cooperate with a wide range of institutions: from political parties to small initiatives, municipalities and federal institutions, international organisations and local initiatives.

Liquid Democracy is also an innovative concept of participatory democracy. Participation is a key to individual empowerment and active citizenship. Our work is based on the belief that democracy in its current state should be more dynamic and allow for more participation. The fix elements and structures of representative democracy should thus be \u00bbliquefied\u00ab.

As a method, Liquid Democracy uses digital technology to integrate individuals in decision-making. The design of our technology ensures a low-threshold and efficient participation that is time and place independent.

"}}]

fields.title_en: Would you like to work with us?
fields.intro_en:
We are a small team of individuals who come from various backgrounds: software development, political science and interface design, to name a few. We are literally growing with our tasks and currently recruiting.


Here's why joining us could be a good idea.
fields.body_en:
[{"type": "image_slider", "value": [10, 11, 12, 13]}, {"type": "columns", "value": {"col1_text": "

It is part of our day-to-day tasks to innovate democratic decision-making processes and thus make significant changes for the citizens and institutions we work for. We are a team of pragmatic idealists who believe in the positive effects of their work.

", "col2_text": "

We are a team of highly competent individuals, each one is an expert in their own field. This implies that we all have an active role in the implementation of our projects and that everyone's respected for their skills. We are growing fast and thus need people who are willing to take resonsibility.

", "col2_headline": "You will take responsibility", "col1_headline": "You will make a change"}}, {"type": "columns", "value": {"col1_text": "

We could not promote the idea of Liquid Democracy if we did not have high demands of our own internal democratic structures. We believe that the outcome of a decision is simply better when more people can bring in their perspectives. Thus, we are not only willing to hear your opinion on our strategy, but we would also like you to bring in new ideas.

", "col2_text": "

We believe that everyone will achieve better results if we truly respect each other, maintain a friendly and familiar atmosphere between our co-workers and a culture of transparency and fairness. In addition to a fair salary you will receive technical equipment which will help you reach the best results comfortably and efficiently.

", "col2_headline": "Fairness is important to us", "col1_headline": "Your voice will count"}}, {"type": "linkbox", "value": {"headline": "Job vacancies", "text": "", "links": [{"internal_link": 13, "link_text": "Student Job"}]}}]

fields.body_en:
[{"type": "project_teaser", "value": {"translated_shorttext": "

We have implemented the Europe-wide idea challenge Advocate Europe in cooperation with Stiftung Mercator.

", "translated_title": "Advocate Europe", "image": 1, "internal_link": 5, "external_url": "https://advocate-europe.eu/en"}}]

Werde Teil unseres Projektmanagement-Teams und arbeite mit uns an innovativen Projekten für eine Demokratie des 21. Jahrhunderts!

Wir über uns

Der Liquid Democracy e.V. ist ein gemeinnütziger Verein mit Sitz in Berlin. Unsere Leitidee besteht darin, die Möglichkeiten digitaler Technologien zu nutzen, um Entscheidungsprozesse partizipativer, demokratischer und transparenter zu gestalten. Seit 2009 entwickeln wir daher die freie Software Adhocracy, mittels derer wir digitale Bürgerbeteiligung in den verschiedensten gesellschaftlichen und organisatorischen Kontexten ermöglichen. Wir arbeiten gemeinsam mit Kunden und Partnern aus Politik, öffentlicher Verwaltung und zivilgesellschaftlichen Organisationen. Zudem betreiben und fördern wir Forschung im Bereich der E-Partizipation

Du bist

  • im fortgeschrittenen Bachelor- oder Masterstudium eines sozial-, geisteswissenschaftlichen oder ähnlichen Fachs
  • interessiert an gemeinnützigen Projekten, Freier Software und partizipativer Demokratie
  • sicher im Umgang mit gängigen Office-Programmen
  • ein Organisationstalent
  • in der Lage, sicher auf deutsch und englisch zu kommunizieren, sowohl in Sprache als auch in Schrift
  • motiviert, lernfähig und in hohem Maße selbständig in Deiner Arbeit
  • erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement und/oder mit SCRUM sind von Vorteil.

Deine Aufgaben

  • Unterstützung der Projektleitung, unter anderem bei:
    • Planung, Koordination und Organisation von mittleren und großen Projekten
    • Konzeption von Anforderungsworkshops und Kundenpräsentationen
  • administrative und konzeptionelle Unterstützung des Projektteams
  • eigenständiges und verantwortliches Arbeiten im Team

Deine Möglichkeiten mit uns

Wir bieten Dir flexible Arbeitszeiten bei einer Entlohnung von 10,98€/h. Die Stelle ist ab sofort zu besetzen.

Schicke uns Deine Bewerbung mit frühestmöglichem Arbeitsbeginn ohne Bewerbungsbild an: application@liqd.de

fields.shorttext_en: We have implemented the Europe-wide idea challenge Advocate Europe in cooperation with Stiftung Mercator.
We are building the platform meinBerlin where the citizens of Berlin can participate in decision-making in their city.
We have built a discussion platform to help decide about the future of Tempelhofer Feld.
We enable collaborative editing of SPD's digital agenda.
